## ErrorX.cleanStack() method

Cleans a stack trace by removing ErrorX internal method calls and optionally trimming after a delimiter. This provides cleaner stack traces that focus on user code.

**Signature:**

```typescript
static cleanStack(stack?: string, delimiter?: string): string;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

stack


</td><td>

string


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Raw stack trace string to clean


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

delimiter


</td><td>

string


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Optional delimiter to trim stack trace after (overrides config delimiter)


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

string

Cleaned stack trace without internal calls and optionally trimmed after delimiter

## Example


```typescript
// Clean with pattern-based removal only
const cleaned = ErrorX.cleanStack(error.stack)

// Clean and trim after delimiter
const trimmed = ErrorX.cleanStack(error.stack, 'my-app-entry')
// Returns stack trace starting after the line containing 'my-app-entry'
```
